THE ANT AND THE DOVE

One hot day, an ant was searching for some water.Another walking around for some time, she came to a spring. To reach the spring, she had to up a blade of grass. While making her way up, she slipped and fell into the water.
She could have drowned if a dove up a nearby tree had not seen her. Seeing that the ant was in trouble, the dove quickly plucked off a leaf and dropped it into the water near the struggling ant. The ant movedtowards the leaf and climbed up there. Just at that time, a hunter nearby was throwing out his nett towards the dove, hoping to trap it.
Gussing that he was about to do, the ant quickly bit him on the heel. Feeling the pain, the hunter dropped the net. The drove was quick to fly away to safety.

"One good turn deserves another."
